Posts.Content: amylynn1108 wrote: I stumbled upon this site when I was first diagnosed in March of this year. I have visited frequently checking out topics and feeling reassured after reading. I decided since I was scared to post a question and let the comforting answers of fellow breast cancer women help calm me down. I was shocked to find that only one person responded to my question. I really had high hopes for this website. Guess I was wrong. Amy Dx 3/24/2011, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: very surprised at how unhelpful this site is amylynn1108 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 02:12PM amylynn1108 wrote: WOW is right, you could possibly be the rudest person ever. I was and am not trying to get negative attention, I was expressing my concerns.
Posts.Title: very surprised at how unhelpful this site is amylynn1108 Moderators

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 01:24PM amylynn1108 wrote: Thank you everyone fo rthe words of encouragement and advice. I am not giving up on this site as I have found stories and threads to be very helpful. I am an extreme worrier, and was scared to death of my 2nd chemo (which I did get on Thursday). I will take all of your advice and find threads to join rather than make my own. I was not aware how the site worked best. I do appreciate everyone for reaching out and helping me figure this out. You are all an amazing group of women and even though I am sorry that we all have to join this board, I am glad that we have each other.
Posts.Title: very surprised at how unhelpful this site is amylynn1108 Moderators
